Entries.Title: Stars and Stripes Forever
Entries.Author: John Philip Sousa
Entries.Description: The most famous American march, composed in 1896. Features an iconic piccolo obbligato in the final strain.

Entries.Title: Washington Post March
Entries.Author: John Philip Sousa
Entries.Description: A lively 6/8 march composed in 1889 for the newspaper's essay contest awards ceremony.

Entries.Title: Semper Fidelis
Entries.Author: John Philip Sousa
Entries.Description: The official march of the United States Marine Corps, composed in 1888.

Entries.Title: El Capitan March
Entries.Author: John Philip Sousa
Entries.Description: Based on the operetta of the same name, this spirited march was composed in 1896.

Entries.Title: National Emblem March
Entries.Author: E.E. Bagley
Entries.Description: A classic American march from 1906. Its trio section quotes The Star-Spangled Banner.

Entries.Title: Block Formation
Entries.Author: builtin
Entries.Description: Standard 6x4 block grid centered on the 50. Classic marching band formation.

Entries.Title: Parade Line
Entries.Author: builtin
Entries.Description: Two rows across the field at the hash marks. Classic parade formation.

Entries.Title: Diamond Formation
Entries.Author: builtin
Entries.Description: Diamond shape centered on the 50-yard line. Concentric rings outward.

Entries.Title: Wedge Formation
Entries.Author: builtin
Entries.Description: V-shaped arrow pointing toward the home sideline. Drum major at the tip.

Entries.Title: Concert Scatter
Entries.Author: builtin
Entries.Description: Artistic scattered positions across the field. Loosely grouped by section.

Entries.Title: V-Shape
Entries.Author: builtin
Entries.Description: Inverted V pointing away from home side. Symmetrical mirrored layout.
